messages:
Name: Emre
Nationality: Turkey
Date of Birth: September 7, 1980
Position: Midfielder
Current club: Fenerbahçe
Süper Lig clubs played for: Galatasaray, Fenerbahçe, İstanbul Başakşehir

Fenerbahçe's Emre has played in the vast majority of the club's Süper Lig games in 2019/2020, making 26 appearances overall and playing 1,435 minutes. He has been selected in the starting XI in 16 of these appearances across their 34 fixtures and been used as a substitute on 10 occasions.

Emre last played in the competition on July 25 for Fenerbahçe against Rizespor. In that match the Turkish player scored for his side in their 3-1 win. The midfielder has netted three Süper Lig goals this season, He has been shown five yellow cards.
He opened his account for the Süper Lig campaign against Gaziantep FK on August 19, scoring during a 5-0 victory.
Last season for İstanbul Başakşehir, Emre made 24 Süper Lig appearances and scored one goal.
Before moving to Fenerbahçe in July 2019, Emre made 104 league appearances in total at İstanbul Başakşehir, scoring 11 goals and providing 20 assists.

Emre began his Süper Lig career for İstanbul Başakşehir on August 15, 2015, playing 79 minutes as a starter versus Antalyaspor aged 34 years and 342 days. He made a good start to Süper Lig life for current team Fenerbahçe as he scored a goal on his debut versus Gaziantep FK on August 19, 2019.

Overall, in his Süper Lig career, he has played 391 games in the competition with 54 goals scored and 25 assists for his team-mates. Emre has also been sent off six times during his Süper Lig stint, with 103 yellow cards collected overall.
